item.description:
The Link Manager page in its current form can't be translated since it generated from the DB. The Link Manager page needs to be rewritten in the manner the other option pages were rewritten for 1.2.

Someone is working on the email.

Most others should be translated. I need to generate a new POT and upload it to codex.

item.title: Ticket #256 (The display of the menu's items in wp-admin/menus.php does not ...) created
item.dc:creator: ortus
item.description:
The display of the menu's items in wp-admin/menus.php does not respect the user-level. I changed the line 76 FROM: echo "\n\t<li><a href='{$item[2]}'$class>{$item[0]}</a></li>"

TO: if ($user_level >= $item[1]) echo "\n\t<li><a href='{$item[2]}'$class>{$item[0]}</a></li>";

item.title: Ticket #255 (The difference of two items as 'categories' and ' batch categories' ...) created
item.dc:creator: ortus
item.description:
in file wp-admin/menus.php line 74 . The difference of two items as 'categories' and 'batch categories' is not detected. Both items are selected and hightligthed : substr test only the last 10 chars.

I suggest to change the line 74 FROM :

if ( substr($self, -10) == substr($item[2], -10) ) $class = ' class="current"';

TO :

if ( substr($self, -15) == substr($item[2], -15) ) $class = ' class="current"';

OR change the function :

if ( strcmp($self,$item[2]) == 0 ) $class = ' class="current"';

item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: yes, but that's a workaround and not a solution :/ Well, thanks, anyways. I'll use that suggestion in future.

item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
rq: With my suggestion, the result would look like this on the permalink page:

< p > text < /p > < ul >

< li > item1 < /li > < li > item2 < a id="more-31" >< /a>< /li > < li > item3 < /li > .....

< /ul >

which validates

item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) updated
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description:
This doesn't exactly solve the problem of the unbalanced < !-- more > attributes, but a plugin I wrote does correctly balance a lot of XHTML errors, and attributes. This includes an 'a' inside a 'ul' tag which, you are right, is invalid according to the specs.

Have a look at X-Valid here: âhttp://www.jamietalbot.com/wp-hacks/ if you're interested...

item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) updated
item.dc:creator: rq
item.description: coffee2code: i'm not sure, but is an < a> tag illegal inside a < ul>? i mean, would it still not validate, if we would simply skip the < p> and < /p> tags?

item.title: Ticket #178 (WP doesn't close tags when breaking a page with < !-- more -- >) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
I attached a very slightly modified version of the .diff. The one-line fix for this bug report needed to also have a newline after the potentially balanced pre-'more' text so that wpautop doesn't misbehave and insert a < /p > without a < p >. This problem was noticed by rq.

However, rq, I don't think WP will be able to do much about the full post having the more's anchor inserted within the < ul > you split with < !--more-- >. If anything, you could try to split the post differently:

< p > text < /p > < ul >

< li > item1 < /li > < li > item2 < !-- more -- >< /li > < li > item3 < /li > .....

< /ul >

The tag balancer will add the < /li > and the < /ul > to balance the pre-'more'. When the full text is shown, the anchor will now be safely located within an < li >.
